# Role Clarification Checklist

Use this checklist at project kickoff to ensure all team members understand their roles, responsibilities, and key interactions with other team members.

**Related**: [Roles and Personas](../octoacme-roles-and-personas.md) | [Role-Responsibility Matrix](role-responsibility-matrix.md)

---

## Pre-Project Setup

### Team Identification
- [ ] All required roles have been identified for this project
- [ ] Team members have been assigned to each role
- [ ] Role assignments have been documented in the project charter or README
- [ ] Backup or supporting team members have been identified for key roles

### Role Understanding
- [ ] Each team member has reviewed their role definition in the [Roles and Personas](../octoacme-roles-and-personas.md) document
- [ ] Team members understand their primary responsibilities
- [ ] Team members understand their goals and success metrics
- [ ] Team members know their typical communication patterns

---

## Role-Specific Clarity

### For Each Role on the Project
Complete this section for each role (Product Manager, Project Manager, Developer, UX Designer, DevOps Engineer, QA Automation Specialist, Business Analyst):

**Role Name**: _________________

- [ ] **Responsibilities Confirmed**: Team member understands and agrees to listed responsibilities
- [ ] **Time Commitment Clear**: Expected time commitment or capacity has been discussed (e.g., full-time, 50%, on-call)
- [ ] **Authority Level Defined**: Decision-making authority is clear (e.g., can approve deployments, can prioritize backlog)
- [ ] **Key Deliverables Identified**: Specific outputs expected from this role are documented
- [ ] **Success Criteria Agreed**: How success will be measured for this role is clear

---

## Cross-Role Interactions

### Communication Channels
- [ ] Primary communication channels have been established (e.g., Slack, Teams, email)
- [ ] Meeting cadence has been agreed upon for each role pairing
- [ ] Escalation paths are documented and understood
- [ ] Status reporting format and frequency are defined

### Handoff Points
Review and clarify handoff points between roles:

- [ ] **Business Analyst → Product Manager**: Requirements documentation and prioritization input
- [ ] **Product Manager → UX Designer**: Feature requirements and user research needs
- [ ] **UX Designer → Developer**: Design specs and implementation guidelines
- [ ] **Developer → QA Automation Specialist**: Feature completion and test requirements
- [ ] **QA Automation Specialist → DevOps Engineer**: Test results and deployment readiness
- [ ] **DevOps Engineer → Project Manager**: Deployment status and infrastructure updates
- [ ] **All Roles → Project Manager**: Progress updates, blockers, and risks

### Collaboration Expectations
- [ ] Code review expectations and turnaround time are clear (for Developers)
- [ ] Design review process is defined (for UX Designers)
- [ ] Test plan review timing is established (for QA)
- [ ] Deployment coordination process is documented (for DevOps)
- [ ] Requirements clarification process is clear (for Business Analysts)

---

## Conflict Resolution

### Decision Rights
- [ ] Final decision-maker has been identified for:
  - [ ] Product/feature decisions
  - [ ] Technical architecture decisions
  - [ ] Timeline and scope trade-offs
  - [ ] Quality and release criteria
  - [ ] Resource allocation

### Escalation Process
- [ ] Level 1 escalation path is documented (team-level)
- [ ] Level 2 escalation path is documented (management-level)
- [ ] Level 3 escalation path is documented (executive/sponsor-level)
- [ ] Escalation criteria are clear (when to escalate)

---

## Project-Specific Considerations

### Unique Aspects of This Project
- [ ] Any role modifications or special responsibilities for this project are documented
- [ ] Overlapping or shared responsibilities have been explicitly discussed
- [ ] Gaps in role coverage have been identified and addressed
- [ ] Any additional roles or stakeholders have been added to the team structure

### Dependencies and Constraints
- [ ] Cross-team dependencies have been identified
- [ ] External stakeholder involvement is documented
- [ ] Resource constraints or limitations are known to all
- [ ] Timeline constraints are understood by all roles

---

## Onboarding Support

### For New Team Members
- [ ] Onboarding buddy or mentor has been assigned
- [ ] Access to necessary tools and systems has been granted
- [ ] Introduction to key stakeholders has been completed
- [ ] Role-specific documentation has been shared

### Knowledge Transfer
- [ ] Previous project context has been shared (if applicable)
- [ ] Domain-specific knowledge has been transferred
- [ ] Existing codebase or design system has been reviewed
- [ ] Key decisions and their rationale have been explained

---

## Periodic Review

### During Project Execution (Weekly/Bi-weekly)
- [ ] Role effectiveness is discussed in team meetings
- [ ] Blockers related to unclear responsibilities are surfaced
- [ ] Changes to team composition or roles are communicated promptly

### At Sprint/Milestone Retrospectives
- [ ] Team reflects on whether roles were clear and effective
- [ ] Gaps or overlaps in responsibilities are identified
- [ ] Role adjustments are proposed and documented if needed
- [ ] Lessons learned are captured for future projects

---

## Sign-off

By completing this checklist, the team confirms that:
1. Each person understands their role and responsibilities
2. Interaction points and handoffs are clear
3. Communication expectations are established
4. Escalation paths are documented
5. Any questions or concerns have been addressed

**Completed by**: _________________  
**Date**: _________________  
**Project**: _________________
